column4: I have an older machine that i installed ubuntu on, for the community support and other things, but was kind of wondering, for a machine running a 500 mhz proc, 184 MB'd of Ram, is there s more suitable , kinda tuned for low low end machines, but with high functionality like Ubuntu ?
Also, Ubuntu doesnt appear to have figured out the video hardware very well, and its stu ck in 800x600, whereas the native would be 1024x768
try a cli install of ubuntu and put LXDE on top of it.
, interesting. Is there a particular site or configuration option to choose a command line install ?
must be done from the alternative cd.
, can i just do a sudo apt-get remove ubuntu-desktop, then apt install lxde ?
Awesome, anyway to figure out what my specific monitor settings are so i can correctly set them in xorg ? its a laptop , so its difficult to find the specs to begin with, much less one this old
like a deep query app that can probe the settings ?
go a google for 'your lappy's product id and xorg'
searched high and low, really not a lot of info for my specfic model
i put quite  a bit of effort into it, trying different search symantics and things, and couldnt find anything on it, its a Compaq Presario 1600XL-145
tried that one too, Trident Cyberblade i1
not finding much of anything on those, try 'xrandr' for possible resolutions.
Thanks for the help though, its a rough one for this machine i beleive :p
not a ton of exp with xrandr, but no better time to learn, eh ?
